intro: Klaineastrum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, often purple or pink flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Klaineastrum species are often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain areas. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
